author: Kieran Nicholson
title: Fountain mom faces child abuse charges; she allegedly locked kids in room, left town
text:
Provided by Fountain Police Department Kanesha Godin A mother in Fountain who allegedly locked two small children in a bedroom while she went away on a trip has been arrested on suspicion of felony child abuse.
Kanesha Godin, 25, was arrested Tuesday after she turned herself in to Fountain police, the department said in a news release. A warrant had been issued for her arrest.
Police said officers on March 8 went to a home in the 100 block of Wellington Street to investigate a report of child abuse.
Godin had arranged, while she was away, for a friend to check on the children once a day, including instructions to feed them and change diapers. Godin, according to police, had told the friend that a neighbor was “providing child care throughout the day and night.”

The friend, who was not identified, contacted authorities.
Godin was being held Tuesday on two counts of felony child abuse.
